description.narrative: The objective of the Barrio Ciudad Project for Honduras is to improve the quality of life for the residents in selected poor urban neighborhoods of the Borrower in eligible municipalities. The closing date for will be extended from June 30, 2012 until June 30, 2013. The extension is necessary to benefit an additional 4,000 residents in the new cities targeted by the second round of investments (Puerto Cortez, Choloma, Choluteca, La Ceiba, and Danli). Furthermore, the Project has demonstrated positive impacts on the prevention of crime and violence in the Project's municipalities and it is closely linked to the strategic importance of the crime and violence prevention agenda of the government. This will be the second extension of the project. A first one year extension was approved on April 2008, extending the closing date to June 30, 2012.

title.narrative: % of households with access to sanitary sewage system in selected neighborhoods.

comment.narrative: Average of indicators in completed neighborhoods (Comayagua, Danli, SRC, El Progreso, Villanueva). The indicator is survey basedand will be updated, including the remaining neighborhoods, after project completion.

title.narrative: % of households who feel safe in the house in selected neighborhoods.

comment.narrative: Average of indicators in completed neighborhoods (Comayagua, Danli, SRC, El Progreso, Villanueva). The indicator is survey basedand will be updated after project completion including all neighborhoods.

title.narrative: % of households with public lighting always working in selected neighborhoods.

comment.narrative: Average of indicators in completed neighborhoods (Comayagua, Danli, SRC, El Progreso, Villanueva, Choloma). The indicator issurveybased and will be updated, including the remaining neighborhoods, after project completion.

title.narrative: % of households with access to water in the household in selected neighborhood.

comment.narrative: Average of indicators in completed neighborhoods (Comayagua, Danli, SRC, El Progreso, Villanueva). The indicator is survey basedand will be updated, including the remaining neighborhoods, after project completion.

title.narrative: % of households satisfied with the project in selected neighborhoods.

comment.narrative: This indicator is survey based and will be updated after project completion.

title.narrative: # of municipal officers trained in environmental management.

comment.narrative: This number also includes FHIS personnel, youth, and community members.

title.narrative: Development of standards for urban planning.
# of FHIS staff, municipal officials and community representatives trained in Crime and Violence prevention.
# of community leaders trained in community development.
# of neighborhood upgrading plans elaborated by municipalities and approved by FHIS.
# of neighborhoods in which CPTED is incorporated in the upgrading.
# of one-stop windows for urbanization created.
# of campaigns for neighborhood clean up.
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention

comment.narrative: This indicator includes Danli, Villanueva, SRC, El Progreso and Comayagua. It will be updated at project completion to include allneighborhoods were new water connections were constructed.

title.narrative: Piped household water connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project

comment.narrative: This indicator includes Danli, Villanueva, SRC, El Progreso and Comayagua. It will be updated at project completion to include allneighborhoods were water connections were improved.
